sen.j: 自治党（じちとう）とは、1888年から翌年にかけて井上馨が進めてきた町村長ら地方の名望家を集めて結成を構想した新党構想であるが、失敗に終わった。
sen.e: Jichi To was the idea of a new political party framed by Kaoru INOUE from 1888 to 1889 that was planned to be formed by organizing men with high public standing such as mayors.

sen.j: 第1次伊藤内閣の末期、条約改正の失敗の責任をとって外務大臣 (日本)を辞任した井上は、町村長ら地方自治運営の主体となる名望家層を結集させて、民党に対抗する保守政党を結成する構想を抱いた。
sen.e: INOUE, who resigned from his post as Minister of Forreign Affairs (Japan) to take responsibility for the failure of a treaty revision at the late stage of the first Ito cabinet, conceived a plan to form a conservative party opposing minto (general term of the political parties such as Liberal Party and Progressive Party that conflicted with the han-dominated government when the Imperial Diet was inaugurated) by organizing men with high local public standing such as mayors, who were the main constituent to manage local autonomies.

sen.e: At the end of July in 1888, INOUE sent a letter to Kiyotaka KURODA, who had asked him to join the cabinet as the Minister of Agriculture and Commerce, and proposed therein that it would be impossible to perpetuate the political rule by the Satsuma-Choshu domain clique and emergences of radical parties of the Freedom and People's Rights Movement and radical nationalists should be avoided by way of forming a new political party organized by middle-class wealthy persons in order to take the lead in local autonomies and let them advance to the national political arena with seasoned political experiences so as to form a moderate conservative power, as a means of cultivating politicians for the next generation to inherit the policy of Fukoku Kyohei (fortifying the country, strengthening the military), which the Meiji Government put forward.

sen.j: 明治政府が進める富国強兵路線を継承する次世代の政治家を育てる手段として中等以上の財産家を集めて新党を結成して地方自治において主導権を握るとともに、彼らに政治的経験を積ませて中央に進出させ、穏健な保守勢力を形成させることで、過激な自由民権派や国粋主義者の台頭を食い止める構想を打ち明けている。

sen.e: On October 15, 1888, after INOUE had joined the cabinet, he proceeded with preparations such as inaugurating "Jichisei Kenkyu Kai" (a study group for autonomy), which was virtually a committee for a new political party, with Munemitsu MUTSU and Shuzo AOKI, and issuing a party newspaper called "Jichi Shinpo".

sen.j: だが、翌年黒田が行った「超然主義演説」や山縣有朋らの反対、条約改正を巡る井上自身と黒田との対立もあって運動は低調となり、1889年夏には事実上計画は中止され、『自治新報』も1890年に廃刊された。
sen.e: However, due to "the doctrine of superiority" of KURODA, the opposition of Aritomo YAMAGATA, as well as the conflict between INOUE and KURODA regarding the treaty revision, the movement cooled down, and thus the plan was stopped in effect in the summer of 1889, and "Jichisei Shinpo" was no longer being published in 1890.
